column2: ENGLISH
Host a confederation congress
You will host a confederation congress and try to create an empire based on your realm
Feudal Monarchy

Under a feudal monarchy, legitimate authority is held to derive from inheritance, while political power is concentrated in the hands of the military, who often form an elite hereditary warrior caste.\n\nMilitary Monarchies may use the following succession laws: Primogeniture, Ultimogeniture, Seniority, Gavelkind, Dynastic Elective, Federal Elective.
Military Republic

In a military republic, legitimate authority is held to derive from the people, while political power is concentrated in the hands of the military. The government may hold military service as a prerequisite for voting rights, or it may be a military dictatorship that styles itself as a provisional government.\n\nMilitary Republics may use the following succession laws: Democratic Elective, Federal Elective, Dynastic Elective.
Military Dictatorship

Under a military dictatorship, legitimate authority is held to derive purely from continuity of government and from higher authorities, while political power is concentrated in the hands of the military's high command. It may be a state ruled by a military junta, an area under martial law, or on a small scale, a simple naval base.\n\nMilitary Dictatorships may use the following succession laws: Appointment, Federal Elective.
Corporate Monarchy

Under a corporate monarchy, legitimate authority is held to derive from inheritance, while political power is concentrated in the hands of wealthy merchants and plutocrats. The family fortunes of the aristocracy and royal family form the backbone of state power.\n\nCorporate Monarchies may use the following succession laws: Primogeniture, Ultimogeniture, Seniority, Gavelkind, Dynastic Elective, Federal Elective.
Liberal Republic

In a liberal republic, legitimate authority is held to derive from the people, while political power is concentrated in the hands of a wealthy upper class. The populace enjoy many political freedoms, but the government nevertheless tends to reflect the interests of the upper class.\n\Liberal Republics may use the following succession laws: Democratic Elective, Federal Elective, Dynastic Elective.
Corporate Dictatorship

Under a corporate dictatorship, legitimate authority is held to derive purely from continuity of government and from higher authorities, while political power comes from the state's vast wealth. The state is run as a business, with the primary purpose being to generate profit for the government.\n\nCorporate Dictatorships may use the following succession laws: Appointment, Federal Elective.
Administrative Monarchy

Under an administrative monarchy, legitimate authority is held to derive from inheritance, while political power is concentrated in the royal bureaucracy and the civil service. There may be a formal aristocracy, but if so, their role is purely ceremonial.\n\nAdministrative Monarchies may use the following succession laws: Primogeniture, Ultimogeniture, Seniority, Gavelkind, Dynastic Elective, Federal Elective.
Administrative Republic

In an administrative republic, legitimate authority is held to derive from the people, while political power is largely concentrated in the bureaucracy and civil service. While the government's highest officials may be democratically elected, most day-to-day policy is set by career civil servants.\n\nAdministrative Republics may use the following succession laws: Democratic Elective, Federal Elective, Dynastic Elective.
Bureaucratic Dictatorship

Under a bureaucratic dictatorship, legitimate authority is held to derive purely from continuity of government and from higher authorities, while political power is concentrated in the hands of the bureaucracy and civil service. Such governments are often organized in accordance with religious, political, or technocratic ideals.\n\nBureaucratic Dictatorships may use the following succession laws: Appointment, Federal Elective.
Pirate Kingdom

Space pirate fleets organized in a top-down fashion are often referred to as kingdoms", and their leaders as pirate kings. Such organizations are not considered legitimate governments, but more properly a form of organized crime syndicate. Unlike pirate republics, pirate kingdoms tend to be more interested in actual piracy than in other forms of crime like smuggling.\n\nPirate Kingdoms may use the following succession laws: Elective Gavelkind."
Pirate Kingdom

Space pirate fleets organized in a top-down fashion are often referred to as kingdoms", and their leaders as pirate kings. Such organizations are not considered legitimate governments, but more properly a form of organized crime syndicate. Unlike pirate republics, pirate kingdoms tend to be more interested in actual piracy than in other forms of crime like smuggling.\n\nPirate Kingdoms may use the following succession laws: Elective Gavelkind."
Pirate Republic

Space pirate fleets organized in a bottom-up fashion are sometimes referred to as pirate republics", but such organizations are usually considered to be a form of organized crime syndicate rather than a legitimate government. Unlike pirate kingdoms, pirate republics are usually more active in smuggling than actual piracy.\n\nPirate Republics may use the following succession laws: Oligarchic Elective."
Lesser Pirate Republic

Space pirate fleets organized in a bottom-up fashion are sometimes referred to as pirate republics", but such organizations are usually considered to be a form of organized crime syndicate rather than a legitimate government. Unlike pirate kingdoms, pirate republics are usually more active in smuggling than actual piracy.\n\nLesser Pirate Republics may use the following succession laws: Appointment."
Colony
This is a newly-founded colony, in a previously uninhabited system. Local government, such as it is, is quite primitive, and it is expected to accord with the demands placed on it by the homeworld.
Hivemind

Government is a meaningless concept to the Hive. All are one, and all decisions are made as a single, schizophrenic organism. For the sake of efficiency, certain units are designated as central processing nodes dedicated to filtering the signal from the Hive's cacaphonic noise, but ultimately all decisions are communal.

Under the current laws of the [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], it is illegal for those not belonging to the hereditary nobility to possess military assets. You have been made a member of the aristocracy, and your offices will henceforth be the property of your family.
Under the current laws of the [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], all military governors must be accountable to their subordinates.
Under the current laws of the [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], all military officers and governors must be appointed directly by their superior officers.

Under the current laws of the [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], it is illegal for those not belonging to the hereditary nobility to hold offices within the civilian government. You have been made a member of the aristocracy, and your offices will henceforth be the property of your family.
Under the current laws of the [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], all local civilian governments must be in some way accountable to the populace.
Under the current laws of the [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], all local civilian governors must be appointed by their direct superiors.
column16: You've traditionally grounded your authority in your command of the military. Unfortunately, it currently happens that you do not actually directly control any military formations. You may have to do something about this.

column2: Under the current laws of the [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], it is illegal for those not belonging to the hereditary nobility to hold ranking positions within the civil service. You have been made a member of the aristocracy, and your offices will henceforth be the property of your family.
Under the current laws of the [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], all ministers of the civil service must be accountable to their subordinates.
Under the current laws of the [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], all ministers of the civil service must be appointed by their direct superiors.

You've traditionally grounded your authority in your command of the military. Unfortunately, it currently happens that you do not actually directly control any military formations. You may have to do something about this.

You've traditionally grounded your authority in the wealth the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] family possesses and its control of the wealthiest planets in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. Unfortunately, it currently happens that you do not actually control any such planets. You may have to do something about this.

You've traditionally grounded your authority in your control over the civil service. Unfortunately, it currently happens that you DON'T control the civil service. You may have to do something about this..
By royal decree - royal, you're going to like the sound of that, you think - the old state has been abolished. In its place, you have founded a new [Root.Government.GetName].

The latest news from [From.Capital.GetName] has finally made its way to [Root.Location.GetName] - [From.GetFullName] has abolished the old system of government, and declared the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] to be a [From.Government.GetName].
The long tyranny is at an end at last - the old state has been abolished. In its place, you have founded a new [Root.Government.GetName].
The age of corruption and misrule is over at last - the old state has been abolished. In its place, you have founded a new [Root.Government.GetName].
It's time for a more hands-on approach.
Why would I need them when I have the Navy?
Fortunately, I can just buy a new power base.
I'll have to turn to the civil service instead.

Having now acquired control of [From.GetName], you immediately set to work adapting the government to suit your needs. From now on, the monarchy will ground its authority in the power of the military and a growing warrior caste.

Having now acquired control of [From.GetName], you immediately set to work adapting the government to suit your needs. While you wish to preserve the [From.GetAdjective] democratic tradition - for now, at least - it is clear that a strong, guiding hand will be needed for the forseeable future.
Having now acquired control of [From.GetName], you immediately set to work adapting the government to suit your needs. As of this moment, the state is now under martial law.
Having now acquired control of [From.GetName], you immediately set to work adapting the government to suit your needs. The monarchy will thrive on the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] family fortune.

Having now acquired control of [From.GetName], you immediately set to work adapting the government to suit your needs. Liberty has been restored, and the nation has become a true republic, where democracy and free enterprise will ensure that the best rise to the top.

Having now acquired control of [From.GetName], you immediately set to work adapting the government to suit your needs. As of this moment, it is your property, and you intend to see that it turns a profit.

Having now acquired control of [From.GetName], you immediately set to work adapting the government to suit your needs. From now on, the monarchy will ground its authority in the power of the civil service, rather than corrupt nobles and merchants.

Having now acquired control of [From.GetName], you immediately set to work adapting the government to suit your needs. The corruption of the [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] regime has been abolished, and true democracy, stewarded by a dedicated civil service, has taken its place.
Having now acquired control of [From.GetName], you immediately set to work adapting the government to suit your needs. The state will now be administered by a meritocratic civil service.
Adopt Administrative Government
It is time to abandon the old ways and embrace Administration.
Adopt Corporate Government
It is time to abandon the old ways and embrace Corporate.
Adopt Military Government
It is time to abandon the old ways and embrace Military.
Adopt Hereditary Legitimacy

It is time to abandon the old ways and embrace the new. True and legitimate authority comes from the blood, not the self-serving heirs to the palace eunuchs or the short-sighted demands of the unwashed rabble.\nUnder hereditary legitimacy, the following succession laws are valid: Primogeniture, Ultimogeniture, Seniority, Gavelkind, Dynastic Elective, Federal Elective.
Adopt Elective Legitimacy

It is time to abandon the old ways and embrace the new. True and legitimate authority can only come from the people, not an accident of birth or an ivory tower regime that pays no mind to the nation it governs.\nUnder hereditary legitimacy, the following succession laws are valid: Democratic Elective, Oligarchic Elective, Federal Elective, .
Adopt Appointment Legitimacy

It is time to abandon the old ways and embrace the new. True and legitimate authority can only come from existing authority, not the uneducated masses or some accident of birth.\nUnder appointment legitimacy, the following success laws are valid: Appointment, Federal Elective.

Monarch
If circumstances allow for it, this trait will force your character to hold a Monarchy government type.
Governor
If circumstances allow for it, this trait will force your character to hold a Republic government type.
Dictator
If circumstances allow for it, this trait will force your character to hold a Dictatorship government type.

column1: #Base Governments: these are the governments that are "generic", there is one for each possible type combination, except having all three types, that is locked to special governments only.

column2: Military Government

Under a military government, the power is within the hands of the commanders, and civil leadership is subordinate to it, in case it exists. This government form can amass troops more easily but might have issues paying them if not being funded by a superior or inferior civilian bureaucracy.
Civil Government

When under civilian rule, the military obeys the state with their own separate power structure, this government is good at amassing taxes, but has few, if any, military bases under the control of the civilian leadership, and thus might be lacking in troops.
Civil Government

When under civilian rule, the military obeys the state with their own separate power structure, this government is good at amassing taxes, but has few, if any, military bases under the control of the civilian leadership, and thus might be lacking in troops.
Rectorate

Any institution controlled by a Rector, is a Rectorate, could be a university, an abbey, or a temple complex that have both. The focus of a Rectorate is assure the institution it controls can reach its goals, it doesn't focus on its population, neither it focuses on its self-defense.
Rectorate

Any institution controlled by a Rector, is a Rectorate, could be a university, an abbey, or a temple complex that have both. The focus of a Rectorate is assure the institution it controls can reach its goals, it doesn't focus on its population, neither it focuses on its self-defense.
Imperialistic Government

This government form is when the leadership of the civilian and military parts of the government are merged into one, although it is unecessary for smaller government, for big enough states it might be useful, with the civilian parts of the government using the military to enforce its interests, while the military has a steady stream of money and resources to keep expanding its strength.
Technocratic Government

The Technocracy is a government that focuses on using all knowledge it can to improve the life of its citizens, such governments tend to invest less in the military and focus on having high quality education available, the leadership also often is composed of appointed technocrats, people that are supposed to reach power because their competence in the field they will government instead of getting there for political reasons.
Technocratic Government

The Technocracy is a government that focuses on using all knowledge it can to improve the life of its citizens, such governments tend to invest less in the military and focus on having high quality education available, the leadership also often is composed of appointed technocrats, people that are supposed to reach power because their competence in the field they will government instead of getting there for political reasons.
Theocratic Government

This government is ruled, according to its name, by a deity, in practice this is an advancement of the Rectorates, instead of managing only a institution now a whole country is governed, this has two results, one is that now it has its own military force, and two, the maximum leader of the government is not a Rector anymore, instead he is a Vicar, the title given to  the assistants of the Rector, since the Rector is supposed to be the deity worshipped by the citizens of such government.
Theocratic Government

This government is ruled, according to its name, by a deity, in practice this is an advancement of the Rectorates, instead of managing only a institution now a whole country is governed, this has two results, one is that now it has its own military force, and two, the maximum leader of the government is not a Rector anymore, instead he is a Vicar, the title given to  the assistants of the Rector, since the Rector is supposed to be the deity worshipped by the citizens of such government.

column1: #Special Governments: these are "generic" specializations needed by the base governments above.

column2: Military Command

This is not a proper state at all, but a command with a national military. Such military commands are strictly subordinate to their issuing authority, and are responsible for prosecuting wars against the enemies of the state.
Military Base Command

This is not a state at all, not being able to be independent. This government only means that the ruler of this location is a military officer that has responsability over the garrison and training of new forces, although it can defend itself, its troops are actually pledged to the hierarchy superiors until they end in the hands of a Military Command that has actual power to move them.

column1: #Ideological Governments: these are governments that exist to enable a particular ideology that can't be done with any of the base governments.

column2: Corporate Republic

In a corporate republic, legitimate authority is held to derive from the people, while political power is concentrated in the hands of a wealthy upper class. The populace enjoy many political freedoms, but the government nevertheless tends to reflect the interests of the upper class.\n\nCorporate Republics may use the following succession law: Oligarchic Elective
Neo-Feudal
This government uses feudalism as a way to organize itself, it is a strictly military government, with all the power being in the hands of private owners of military bases.
